intro: Hieracium froelichianum subsp. wimmeri, commonly known as the Wimmer's common hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that bears yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as meadows and roadsides. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in a single head. The subspecies wimmeri is distinguished by its specific morphological traits that set it apart from other members of the Hieracium species.
